summary: Frontend adds an access-denied recovery UI on ParentDashboardPage, but it does not conditionally show the "Become Parent Admin" action based on whether an admin exists. Backend changes are truncated too early to verify REQ-13/REQ-14 implementation, and the hooks file is truncated so REQ-16 cannot be fully confirmed.

missing_requirements.requirement: Show a "Become Parent Admin" action only when the backend indicates that no admin exists; on success, refresh admin status and unlock the Parent Dashboard without a page reload.
missing_requirements.reason: ParentDashboardPage renders the "Become Parent Admin" button whenever `isAdmin` is false, without any query/check for whether an admin exists (no backend-indicated gating is present in the shown code).

hallucinated_features.description: Always showing a "Become Parent Admin" button on the Parent Dashboard access-denied screen whenever the user is not admin (without checking whether an admin already exists).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest requires this action be shown *only* when backend indicates no admin exists; the implemented UI does not perform that check and will show the button even when an admin exists.
